intro: Jamesia americana subsp. californica, commonly known as the California flax or golden flax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its striking golden-yellow flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained environments. It is a perennial species that produces showy inflorescences in the spring. Botanically, it belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes other plants known for their medicinal and ornamental value.
